channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Trump taps hawkish former Senator David Perdue as ambassador to China
item.description: US president-elect says ex-Georgia senator will help maintain a 'productive working relationship with China'.

item.title: Can Indian billionaire Gautam Adani be tried in the US for India ‘crimes’?
item.description: The recent allegations by US prosecutors highlight jurisdictional complexities that could determine Adani's fate.

item.title: South Korea’s ruling party leader calls for suspension of Yoon’s powers
item.description: Han Dong-hoon says 'credible evidence' shows president intended to arrest political leaders.

item.title: US police release images of person of interest in UnitedHealth CEO’s murder
item.description: New York Police Department releases CCTV stills showing a man wearing a hooded jacket with his face clearly visible.

item.title: US judge rejects Boeing plea deal in fatal MAX 737 crashes
item.description: Ruling creates uncertainty around Boeing's criminal prosecution in connection with development of its bestselling plane.

item.title: Paraguay expels visiting Chinese envoy who urged lawmakers to reject Taiwan
item.description: China has made diplomatic inroads in Latin America where trade concerns have led countries to end relations with Taiwan.

item.title: Memphis rejects federal calls for police oversight after Tyre Nichols probe
item.description: Police practices in the US city came under scrutiny following the fatal beating of Tyre Nichols in January 2023.

item.title: Israeli strikes on Gaza kill dozens as Hamas official says talks resume
item.description: Israel struck displacement camp in al-Mawasi as Amnesty says Israel's actions in Gaza amount to genocide.

item.title: Syrian opposition forces capture Hama
item.description: Syrian opposition fighters have entered and taken control of large parts of the city of Hama.

item.title: South Korea President Yoon under investigation for martial law chaos
item.description: South Korean police are investigating President Yoon Suk-yeol for sedition after his martial law declaration spark chaos

item.title: Cuba restores power grid but planned outages to resume amid energy crisis
item.description: School and work activities resume, but Cuban authorities say policy of rolling, five-hour daily blackouts will continue.

item.title: Russia’s Lavrov clashes with Blinken at OSCE meeting
item.description: Blinken emphasizes Ukraine's sovereign right to make choices about its future without interference from Moscow.

item.title: Hezbollah backs Syria’s al-Assad as opposition forces intensify offensive
item.description: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres calls for de-escalation, warns tens of thousands in Syria are at risk.

item.title: Bahamas rejects Trump proposal to take in deported third-country migrants
item.description: Countries across the Americas are bracing for US president-elect's plan to carry out a mass deportation operation.

item.title: Israel wants to continue war on Gaza, but to what end?
item.description: US political scientist Stephen Zunes argues that the only way to stop Israeli war crimes is to change US policy.

item.title: Meet the Polish pro-Palestinian artist challenging taboos about Israel
item.description: Artist Igor Dobrowolski is ensuring pro-Palestinian messages have a place in Poland.

item.title: France’s Macron pledges to stay in office until end of term
item.description: The French president says he will appoint a new prime minister in 'coming days' after lawmakers toppled the government.

item.title: Theatre of Violence: The ICC’s landmark trial of a former child soldier
item.description: A Ugandan defence lawyer asks whether the International Criminal Court (ICC) is imposing a new form of colonialism.

item.title: Syrian opposition fighters enter Hama
item.description: Syrian opposition fighters enter the city of Hama. Government forces have withdrawn from the area.

item.title: Brazilian vet hopes to rescue heron with cup stuck in throat
item.description: A Brazilian biologist who spotted a heron with a plastic cup stuck in its throat is on a mission to save it.

item.title: French government falls: What’s next for Macron, Le Pen, France?
item.description: French legislators from both sides of the political spectrum voted to remove Barnier from power.

item.title: “Entire neighbourhoods” in Gaza being levelled by Israeli contractors
item.description: Jehad Abusalim on how Israel is decimating the Gaza Strip, and what that means for the people living there.

item.title: Video: People flee North Gaza after Israel’s ‘leave-or-die’ orders
item.description: Israel issued more forced evacuation orders for people in northern Gaza.

item.title: Bangladesh mission in India attacked: Why are ties in freefall?
item.description: India-Bangladesh relations further strained as two nations trade accusations of alleged attacks on Hindus.

item.title: “Forget about” Israel withdrawing from Gaza
item.description: Gideon Levy, a columnist for Haaretz, talks about what he sees as proof of Israel’s intent to remain in Gaza.
